item.name: The Brass Dwarf
entries: {@i The Brass Dwarf} represents invulnerability. When you invest {@i The Brass Dwarf}, you gain resistance to fire equal to your level.

Choose {@trait acid}, {@trait cold}, {@trait electricity}, {@trait fire}, {@trait mental}, {@trait poison}, or {@trait sonic}. You can't choose the damage type for which {@i The Brass Dwarf} currently gives you resistance. You gain resistance to the damage you chose equal to your level, and you lose the prior resistance that {@i The Brass Dwarf} gave you. For 1 minute, you gain weakness equal to half your level to the damage type of the prior resistance.

item.name: The Empty Throne
entries: {@i The Empty Throne} represents great loss and wisdom from those who are now gone. As long as you have {@i The Empty Throne} invested, it grants you a +2 item bonus to {@skill Society} and {@skill Lore} checks made to {@action Recall Knowledge} regarding individuals who are no longer alive (such as checks to learn about Taldor's historical founder but not to learn about its current empress). This increases to a +3 item bonus if you are at least 17th level.
You overwhelm a target you can see within 60 feet with feelings of helplessness and loss. The creature must attempt a Will DC equal to your class DC.

Success: The target can't benefit from circumstance or status bonuses for 1 round.
Failure: The target can't benefit from circumstance or status bonuses for 1 day, and the target's allies are unable to benefit from circumstance or status bonuses while within 15 feet of the target.
Critical Failure: As failure, except the duration is 1 week.

item.name: The Paladin
entries: {@i The Paladin} represents righteousness and resolute defense. As long as you have {@i The Paladin} invested, you gain the {@feat Shield Block} general feat. If you already possess this feat, you gain an additional reaction at the start of your turn that can only be used to {@feat Shield Block}.

entries.trigger: You fail or critically fail a saving throw
entries: Adjust the result of your saving throw up by one degree of success.

item.name: The Rabbit Prince
entries: {@i The Rabbit Prince} represents the unreliability of hand-to-hand combat and how even cunning foes can lose to lucky novices. As long as you have {@i The Rabbit Prince} invested, it grants you a +1 status bonus to attack rolls you make as a readied action.

entries.trigger: You miss a creature with a melee weapon {@action Strike}
entries: Reroll the triggering {@action Strike} with a +1 status bonus. If you hit, attempt a DC {@flatDC 15} flat check; on a failure, your weapon gains the {@condition broken} condition (if your weapon is already {@condition broken}, it's destroyed). If you're at least 14th level, this flat check is DC {@flatDC 10}. If you're at least 17th level, this flat check is DC {@flatDC 5}.
